title: PSA: If your 6 kills to 26 deaths and 8 towers down 20 minutes in it time to give up.
body: I'll keep playing but at that point it isn't fun.  You voting no doesn't give you any experience.  There isn't any throw coming your way, they are 2 items ahead now and 3+ levels.  The game is no longer worth anything, they could throw 3 times and still be ahead.  Just vote yes and move on to the next game.  All you are doing is making people feel worthless and lame.  You are making them suffer.

replies.body: Maybe you are losing so bad because people are playing new champs.  They might be learning mechanics or new roles.  I vote NO every time if I am learning a new champ because thats the only way I will get better.
Being 0/9 doesnt really teach you how to play a champ when the enemy tank 1 shots your. That is what he is getting at I think.

Exactly.  The global gold and lead at this point is so absurd it isn't even a game anymore.  I don't give up easy but you can't just ignore the reality of overwhelming numerical advantage when your opponents have 3+ levels on ya and a full item ahead.
When the game gets out of hand like that I greatly prefer just moving on to a fresh game where I can try again.

I disagree actually.  I just sadly played TOP lane Fiora, and i have only played her maybe 3 other times and very I suck both in top lane and with her.  I did terrible!  I seriously was 0/9/0 it was very embarrassing.  But you know what?  I started to come back and learned limitations and the match up I was playing so now I know or at least "should" know when I can go in and when I need to play more safe.  My team was awesome, didnt rage on me at all and we won!

How many towers/inhibs were you down when you were 0/9?  One lane losing is a situation that can be worked with.  8 towers down though?  there are only 3 outer 3 inner and that leaves 2 inhibs. 8 towers is a LOT of global gold.  It is practically a full item for each member of the team.  To say nothing of being 6/26.  The gold difference was insane.  I don't give up just because I lose lane or someone else does.  I give up when it really is hopeless.
as long as no ones flaming/toxic ill surrender but if they are.... well then they are going to suffer.
the point here is that. while its theoratically possible to win. you will get more LP by surrendering and playing a new game . on average.

that is only the case if you have a high winrate
this only applies when you are winning more games than losing on average :^)

I feel like people are missing the point. No game is unwinnable. Through hard work and perseverance, any game can be turned around. That said, there are lots of good reasons to not want to claw your way through the rest of the game. Don't be a "never surrender" douchebag. Don't be a "ff@20" douchebag. Sometimes people want to quit. Sometimes they don't. Differences in opinion happen.

My friends and I say something similar about surrendering unless we are really stomped: "Not every game can be won, but every game can be thrown." I know I've lost games, where our team won every lane, simply because the enemy defended well and grouped together better.
or they get cocky af and get themselves killed, i've seen it happen.
It's all about attitude. As long as ur team has a good attitude a comeback is possible.

I wish that was so, but reality is some games are not winable.  Two inhibs at 20 mintues is one of those cases.  Perhaps if we had some towers of our own but 8 towers down is too much global gold for the enemy.  Perhaps if only one inhib fell and we held the second to buy time.  Two though?  We couldn't even leave base they had free reign to get baron and just win at that point.

Idk man. I get that the chances of winning are very slim but there are hundreds of games every day where the enemy throws a lead like that allowing themselfs to get caught out and having the enemy team rush baron and towers gaining them the precious levels and buying time for them to recover. 

*yes I know that hundreds of games a day is in no way verifiable but with how often it happends to me I can safely assume that it happends for others as well*

Even if they were to throw or didn't know how to close out a game.

There'd be no satisfaction, hell even disatisfaction. We didn't earn the win, it was given to us on a silver platter by stupid players who either threw or were clueless in closing out games. 
I'm dissatisfied with a win that takes 50min of suffering and stalling. The way season 4 games were played. Long, boring and with a touch of uselessness until you FINALLY catch up (if at all)
Thats your own fault. I find that winning in the face of all odds stacked against me to be very satisfying. but I could be wrong here.
Long comeback games are the best imo.  Though I'm probably biased because I'm better at playing the mid and late game than the early/laning phase.

In Bronze V they are. A game ain't over until  your Nexus is dead, people don't prioritize ending the game over baron and throws are common. Also team work is shit since most bronze players have a proud attitude and refuse to listen to a guy trying to lead the team.
Im just not a fan of waiting until 45+ to see if we can catch a break :p

I'm just going to say that people can do that they want. If they want some experience in playing from behind, then that's their right to get that experience. If they want some IP for a longer match, then that's their right. Your team might be really good in the late game and be able to actually capitalize off of the enemy team's throw if they've been keeping up in cs. People also disconnect. It's rare, but an enemy team member or two could leave. (Maybe they're duo queueing and there's a storm in the area?) Boom, there's your chance to get back in the game. 
There are also those tragic stories of the people who lose games because their team jokingly starts a surrender vote when massively ahead and people press yes. You could be the winner in this situation if it happened after you decided to stick it out.
Another possible situation: Someone on the enemy team gets tilted based on something that was said and starts intentionally feeding. There's a huge chance for you to get back in the game.
One last example: Your teammate was playing with terrible lag the whole match and it just cleared up. If your teammate is good enough, he or she might be able to swing the game in your favor. 

No game is lost until it is truly lost. You have every right to start a surrender vote and others have every right to vote yes or no depending on how they feel.

There's no good rule for when it is or is not appropriate to surrender.

Last night, I played a losing game. Every lane got beat to an extent, and they got several towers on us. It wasn't quite 6-26 at 20 minutes, but it was probably about 12-26 at that point.

The mid/top duo attempted to surrender, and when the other three of us voted no, they AFKed. But the enemy was sloppy and their team comp was bad (no tanks), so were actually able to 3v5 ace them on our Nexus to halt the bleeding. We were poised to continue winning team fights and stage a comeback. Too bad our mid and top were AFK by that point. With zero Nexus towers remaining, the enemy team simply suicided in to finish off our Nexus to win. With a full team of 5, I think we had a decent chance of holding out. 

League is a game where if you score an ace after the ~30+ minute mark, you're going to gain some serious objectives. Hell, at a certain point, an ace means you simply win the game, even if they still have half their towers up. So unless the enemy is objectively impossible to answer, a surrender is kinda just laziness.
I would just afk. Problem solved. I don't mind the 20 minute waits.
Unfortunately, you just become a scape-goat at that point to get reported.  Sad but true.  As I say, I'll keep playing but really its pointless at that point.

We can even be ahead, but if my team starts acting like toddlers, I'm putting everyone on mute and splitting solo the rest of the game, if I don't just afk from all the trolling and unhelpfulness.

You aren't taking into account several factors that may give someone a reason not to surrender.

- A player might not have time for another game and is trying to squeeze as much gameplay time as possible before he has to turn League off.
- A player might be trying out a new champion and no matter how far behind they are, he'd still like the experience he can gain mechanically by keeping the game going. Which might also avoid HAVING/BEING FORCED to play that same champion the next game if he played a decent amount of minutes to satisfy him in that game.
- A player might refuse to FF when the players initiating the Surrender Vote are being extremely toxic and childish. That player can proceed to mute those players and hold them hostage in their own toxic game as punishment.
- And games CAN be thrown, maybe not the higher Elo you go, but the more you go down, you'll notice that throwing no matter how big the lead, is VERY common.

I can go on really but what's the point really? And I can actually list more reasons for not surrendering by the way.
You're probably just going to ignore the valid reasons I've shared, and you and everyone else on here will downvote this to the abyss like every other reply defending the refusal to surrender.

Ultimately there is a vote in place for a reason. If someone refuses to surrender deal with it. Go live in North Korea if you get butthurt with democracy not going your way.
This huge rant and circlejerk of salty people downvoting anyone disagreeing with this is pretty pathetic.

EDIT: and also the distinction between surrendering a normal or a ranked game should be done.
